title: Massive cloudburst in Uttarakhand: Entire village swept away; 4 dead, several missing
content: A cloudburst-triggered flash flood in Uttarkashi's Dharali village caused widespread devastation, sweeping away homes, shops, and roads. Rescue teams, including SDRF and Army personnel, are on-site conducting relief operations amid fears that laborers may be trapped. The Meteorological Department has issued warnings for continued heavy rainfall across Uttarakhand, particularly in hilly areas, until August 10.

title: 'Right to choose': Russia backs India, rebukes Trump's tariff threat over crude oil
content: The Kremlin has defended India's right to choose its trading partners, criticizing Trump's threat to raise tariffs over Russian oil imports. India has rebuffed Trump's warning as "unjustified," asserting its oil purchases are driven by market conditions. India vowed to protect its interests, noting that the US and EU also trade with Russia.

title: CBSE Class 10 Supplementary Result 2025 released: Check marksheet
content: The CBSE declared the Class 10 Supplementary Exam Result 2025 on August 5, accessible on official websites and platforms like DigiLocker. Out of 1,38,898 students, 67,620 passed, resulting in an overall pass percentage of 48.68%. The board has announced the schedule for verification of marks, scanned copies of answer sheets, and re-evaluation, with online applications available soon.

title: 'Poora khol ... ': Owaisi's explosive comment on Mohammed Siraj
content: India secured a thrilling six-run victory against England in the final Test at The Oval, drawing the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's outstanding five-wicket haul in the second innings was pivotal, earning him Player of the Match. Shubman Gill, stepping in as captain, also shone, receiving the Player of the Series award for his exceptional performance.

title: GitHub CEO to software engineers: Either you ..., or get out of your career
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke warns software engineers to embrace AI or risk career obsolescence, emphasizing AI's central role in coding. He envisions developers evolving into AI strategists, focusing on higher-level problem-solving and AI-driven solutions. The future anticipates AI writing 90% of code, urging engineers to reinvent their roles as code enablers and embrace human-AI collaboration.

title: 'This day that year': Amid Trump tariff heat, Army recalls 1971 war; news clip shows how US helped Pak
content: India-US relations face strain over Russian oil imports. The Indian Army recalls US support for Pakistan in 1971. Donald Trump criticizes India's oil trade, threatening higher tariffs. India defends its energy policy, citing national interest. The Ministry of External Affairs calls US and EU stance unjustified. New Delhi points to Western nations' continued trade with Russia.

title: Several homes, hotels washed away: Cloudburst triggers flash floods in Uttarkashi - Details
content: A devastating cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district triggered severe flash floods, washing away homes and hotels in Dharali village. Approximately 10-12 people are feared trapped, with rescue operations underway by the Army, SDRF, and NDRF. Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami is closely monitoring the situation, ensuring all possible assistance is provided to the affected region.

title: Former J&K governor Satyapal Malik passes away at 79
content: Satya Pal Malik, the former Governor of Jammu and Kashmir, passed away at 79 in New Delhi due to complications from a urinary tract infection and kidney failure. He served as the last Governor of J&K during the abrogation of Article 370 in August 2019.

title: Anupam Mittal slams US on visa mess, says: Dear America, doesn’t look like ...
content: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal comments on US visa policies. He appreciates the UK's welcoming approach towards India. Mittal highlights the India-UK trade deal. He points out the significant contributions of Indians to the US economy. Mittal suggests India is now negotiating global deals on its own terms. He implies that the US's approach may not be effective.

title: Trump's tariff jibes: India calls out US, EU hypocrisy – 10-point reply
content: India has strongly responded to US President Trump's tariff threats, highlighting the hypocrisy of Western nations continuing trade with Russia while criticizing India's oil imports. India defends its energy procurement as vital for national interest and points out the significantly larger trade volumes between Europe and Russia.

title: IND vs ENG: What is Mohammed Siraj’s nickname? Broad reveals
content: Former England pacer Stuart Broad lauded Mohammed Siraj's skill and spirit after his impressive performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. Siraj, the leading wicket-taker with 22 wickets, earned the nickname 'Mr. Angry' from England players for his relentless passion. Broad highlighted Siraj's strategic bowling, dismissing key batsmen and securing India's series-drawing victory.

title: Watch: Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari's convoy attacked; vehicle damaged
content: Suvendu Adhikari, West Bengal's leader of the opposition, faced an alleged attack on his convoy in Cooch Behar. He was traveling to the Superintendent of Police's office when the incident occurred, prompting investigations into the region's law and order situation. Details regarding the attack's specifics, potential injuries, and involved parties remain unconfirmed as authorities delve into the matter.

title: Indian man’s MacBook trick: Saves Rs 36,500 by flying to Vietnam and taking a full vacation
content: An Indian man saved Rs 36,500 on a MacBook by purchasing it in Vietnam, leveraging lower prices, VAT refunds, and remote work. His 11-day trip to Hanoi combined sightseeing with a major electronics purchase. This strategy highlights the benefits of cross-border shopping, inspiring others to consider similar approaches for high-value electronics.

title: NASA monitors 2025 OT7 asteroid: Earth flyby on August 5; size, speed, distance revealed
content: Space is an active place. Asteroid 2025 OT7 will fly by Earth in August 2025. It is about 170 feet wide. It will travel at high speed. It will pass at a safe distance. NASA and other agencies monitor such objects. ISRO is also planning asteroid missions. These events highlight the need for planetary defense.

title: Siraj's success story: Mother's daily prayers, visit to late father's grave
content: Mohammed Siraj's journey is fuelled by his father's dream and his mother's prayers. He honours his father's memory by visiting his grave before and after tours, drawing strength from his blessings. Virat Kohli's unwavering support transformed Siraj, while Cristiano Ronaldo's 'Believe' inspired him to excel, culminating in a remarkable performance in England, becoming the highest wicket-taker.

title: Kakoli Dastidar appointed chief TMC LS whip; Satabdi Roy named deputy leader
content: Following internal discord and a lack of coordination among MPs, Trinamool Congress appointed Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar as its chief whip in Lok Sabha after Kunal Ghosh's resignation. Satabdi Roy has been named the deputy leader in the Lower House. Kalyan Banerjee's resignation as chief whip stemmed from unease within the party due to public spats with fellow TMC MPs.

title: 'Men don't belong in women sports': Trump admin restricts trans athletes visas
content: The Donald Trump administration planned to update visa rules. This aimed to prevent transgender women from participating in women's sports in America. US Citizenship and Immigration Services called it a matter of safety. The policy impacted visa categories for individuals with extraordinary abilities. It also extended to national interest waivers.

title: August 5 may be shortest day ever: Earth spins faster; air pressure to blame
content: On August 5, 2025, Earth is expected to experience a slightly shorter day, approximately 1.34 milliseconds less than 24 hours. This phenomenon is attributed to changes within the Earth's core and atmospheric fluctuations. While imperceptible to humans, this acceleration could impact precise timekeeping systems like atomic clocks and GPS networks, requiring adjustments to maintain synchronization.

title: Conor McGregor invites Trump to Dublin pub: Offers “Ireland’s best coke” experience
content: Conor McGregor, amidst recent controversies and a potential presidential run, has extended an invitation to Donald Trump to visit his Black Forge Inn pub in Dublin. The former UFC double champion and known Trump supporter referenced their past White House visit from earlier this year and even shared an AI-generated image of them as knights.

title: Brooke Hogan’s husband slams Hulk Hogan: No effort to meet grandkids — “There was no interest”
content: Hulk Hogan's relationship with his daughter Brooke was strained before his death, with her husband, Steven Oleksy, revealing Hogan showed no interest in meeting his newborn twins, despite Brooke's efforts to reconnect. The couple had moved to Florida to support Hogan, but he remained distant, leaving Brooke heartbroken by unanswered attempts to reconcile.

title: Gill's special collectibles from unforgettable England series - see pics
content: Shubman Gill's remarkable England tour is commemorated with keepsakes like the Headingley stump and a signed jersey from his Edgbaston centuries. The newly appointed Test captain amassed 754 runs, nearly surpassing Gavaskar's record, while leading India to a series-leveling win. His calm leadership and dependable scoring earned him the Player of the Series award.

title: 'Saiyaara' box office day 19 collection: Earnings dip after crossing Rs 300 cr
content: Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara,' released on July 18, enjoyed a successful two-week run, crossing Rs 300 crore. However, its performance has slowed in the third week due to the rise of 'Mahavtar Narsimha,' which outperformed new releases 'Son Of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2'. 'Mahavtar Narsimha' is set to cross Rs 100 crore, impacting 'Saiyaara's' momentum.

title: Kalyan vs Mahua: TMC leaders trade barbs in public; all you need to know about feud
content: "In 2023, I stood by Ms Moitra when she was under fire in Parliament — I did so out of conviction, not compulsion. Today, she repays that support by calling me a misogynist," Kalyan Banerjee said while posting the video on X.

title: Who is Putin's secret daughter? Meet Elizaveta Krivonogikh - details
content: Elizaveta Krivonogikh, believed to be Vladimir Putin's daughter, has condemned him. She accused an unnamed man of destroying her life. Many interpret this as an attack on Putin. Elizaveta now lives in Paris and supports Ukraine. She works at art galleries known for anti-war exhibitions. Her shift from luxury to activism has drawn attention.

title: IND vs ENG | 'May your tribe grow': Ashwin urges Indians to celebrate Siraj
content: R Ashwin lauded Mohammed Siraj's match-winning performance in the fifth Test against England, emphasizing his crucial role in India's series-leveling victory. Ashwin highlighted Siraj's relentless attitude and unwavering commitment, even when facing challenges.

title: 'Take tuition classes from me': Kharge vs Nadda faceoff in Rajya Sabha; watch video
content: Rajya Sabha was in turmoil as Mallikarjun Kharge criticized the presence of security personnel during opposition protests, leading to a dispute with the Deputy Chairman and BJP leaders. Kharge claimed CISF personnel entered the House, which Harivansh refuted, stating it was the Parliament Security Service. Union Minister Kiren Rijiju accused Kharge of misleading the House, while JP Nadda criticized the opposition's conduct.

title: Operation Nagni TOP: Terror hideout busted in J&K's Kupwara; weapons recovered
content: In a significant counter-terrorism effort, the Indian Army's Operation Nagni in Kupwara, Jammu and Kashmir, resulted in the discovery of a terror hideout. The joint operation, involving the Army, police, and BSF, led to the seizure of arms, explosives, and ammunition.

title: 'Unwarranted observation': INDIA bloc backs Rahul Gandhi on SC rap
content: The INDIA bloc has strongly criticized the Supreme Court's remarks against Rahul Gandhi regarding his comments on the Indian Army and Chinese aggression. The alliance defended Rahul's right to question the government as leader of opposition, emphasizing the duty to hold the government accountable on matters of national interest.

title: Delhi: 15-year-old girl out for snacks shot dead in market by ‘boyfriend’; accused on the run
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, a 15-year-old girl was fatally shot by her 20-year-old boyfriend in a crowded market area. The accused, who is currently absconding, allegedly fired multiple rounds at the girl in front of a clinic, leading to her death.

title: Delhi School Education Bill explained: Key provisions & more
content: The Delhi School Education (Transparency in Fixation and Regulation of Fees) Bill, 2025, aims to regulate fee hikes in private schools through a three-tier oversight system. Though pitched as a transparency measure, it has drawn criticism over clauses like the 15% surplus allowance, with concerns that it grants excessive leeway to school managements while limiting real accountability.

title: 'Never hid my past': Seer ousted from mutt after Aadhaar reveals Muslim roots
content: Nijalinga Swamiji, a 22-year-old seer, was compelled to resign from a mutt in Chamarajanagar district after villagers raised objections regarding his prior Muslim identity before embracing Basava Deeksha five years ago.

title: Chennai Grand Masters 2025: More rounds, biggest-ever prize pool, and what more?
content: The Chennai Grand Masters 2025 is set to begin from August 6 to 15, boasting an expanded format, an elite lineup, and a record prize pool. Pranav V, the reigning FIDE World Junior Champion, will debut in the Masters section, while Karthikeyan Murali replaces Vladimir Fedoseev. Harshvardhan GB, the first IM, joins the Challengers, promising intense competition.

title: Amid Trump’s tariff threats, India plans Rs 20,000cr project for exporters
content: India is set to launch a ₹20,000 crore Export Promotion Mission by September to shield exporters from global trade uncertainties. The initiative aims to improve export credit access, address non-tariff barriers, and promote 'Brand India' internationally.

title: What you sow is what you reap! Ashwin lambasts Stokes - Details inside
content: In a dramatic turn of events, India clinched a narrow victory against England, leveling the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. The match reignited the debate around injury substitutions, sparked by Chris Woakes' courageous appearance with an arm injury. R. Ashwin criticized Ben Stokes' earlier dismissal of injury substitutions as a 'joke,' highlighting the lack of empathy and suggesting a need for reconsideration.

title: Ethanol-blended petrol push: Is your vehicle ready? 10 things to know
content: India's early achievement of its E20 ethanol blending target has sparked debates over mileage and engine performance. The government refutes claims of significant fuel efficiency drops, citing minimal impact on E20-compatible vehicles and emphasizing environmental benefits like reduced carbon emissions.

title: ‘They don’t decide who a true Indian is’: Priyanka defends Rahul after SC rebuke
content: "With due respect to the honourable judges of the Supreme Court, they do not decide who a true Indian is. It is the duty of the opposition leader to question the government. My brother (Rahul Gandhi) would never speak against the Army, he holds them in the highest respect. This is a misinterpretation," the Congress MP said while talking to reporters.

title: Rs 17,000cr loan ‘fraud’ case: ED grills Anil Ambani; why is he under lens?
content: Anil Ambani faced questioning by the Enforcement Directorate in New Delhi concerning a significant loan fraud case involving ?17,000 crore. This action follows a Look Out Circular issued against him and a large-scale ED operation targeting Reliance Anil Ambani Group companies. The investigation is probing alleged financial irregularities and potential violations under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: IND vs ENG Tests: Only ONE cricket pundit got series prediction spot on!
content: India pulled off a stunning 6-run victory against England in the final Test, drawing the series 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's crucial wickets on Day 5 sealed the win as England fell short of their 374-run target. Dinesh Karthik was the only expert to accurately predict the series outcome, defying widespread predictions of an England victory.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ enters box office history: Becomes 16th biggest Hindi film ever
content: Saiyaara, starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda and directed by Mohit Suri, has achieved remarkable success, grossing Rs 302.25 crore in 18 days. The romantic drama has surpassed blockbusters like Padmaavat and Sultan, becoming the 16th highest-grossing Hindi film. This triumph marks a significant comeback for Suri and establishes Panday and Padda as promising talents in Bollywood.

title: 6 years & counting: Amit Shah becomes longest-serving home minister
content: Amit Shah has become India's longest-serving Union Home Minister, surpassing L.K. Advani's record. He has served for 2,258 days, achieving this milestone on the anniversary of the Article 370 abrogation. Key developments during his tenure include the abrogation of Article 370, the Ram Janmabhoomi temple construction, new criminal laws, and the Citizenship Amendment Act.

title: Tariff war: Why Trump's threat is unlikely to wean India off Russian crude - Explained
content: India is likely to continue sourcing crude oil from Russia if it remains cheaper, despite potential pressure from the US government. The decision is based on prioritizing consumer interests and market realities, with India emphasizing the transparency of its oil trade with Russia. Recent decline in India's crude petroleum imports from Russia is due to market dynamics.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are gold rates headed on August 5
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are poised for potential gains, buoyed by a weak US nonfarm payroll report and concerns regarding the Federal Reserve's independence after President Trump's dismissal of a BLS chief. Despite range-bound trading, gold's outlook remains positive, influenced by upcoming US data and tariff developments, with investors closely monitoring support and resistance levels.

title: IND vs ENG | 'I miss Bumrah': Siraj after his heroics at The Oval Test - Watch
content: Mohammed Siraj's stellar performance, including a crucial five-wicket haul, propelled India to a thrilling six-run victory over England in the fifth Test, drawing the series 2-2. Despite missing a catch and feeling the pressure, Siraj's self-belief and determination fueled his match-winning performance. He expressed admiration for Jasprit Bumrah, wishing he could have shared the special moment.

title: Russiagate 'hoax': US attorney general orders grand jury probe of Obama officials- Report
content: Pam Bondi directed her staff to proceed with the criminal referral. This concerns the alleged Russia-Trump conspiracy. The Department of Justice is initiating a grand jury investigation. An unnamed federal prosecutor will present evidence. This could lead to an indictment. The DOJ received Tulsi Gabbard's criminal referral two weeks prior. It included documentation about the 2016 election.

title: Tariff threat: Congress’s ‘dost dost na raha’ swipe at PM Modi
content: Congress has strongly criticised PM Modi, highlighting Trump's tariff threats due to India's Russian oil imports, questioning the value of their touted friendship. Jairam Ramesh referenced past events like 'Howdy Modi' and Trump's claims of brokering peace between India and Pakistan, suggesting a deterioration in US-India relations. He also pointed out challenges from China, America, and Pakistan.

title: Unpaid salaries, wage revision: Why Karnataka transport workers are protesting
content: A strike by Karnataka's state-run transport workers has disrupted bus services across the state, causing significant inconvenience to commuters. The workers are protesting over unpaid salaries, wage revision delays, and privatization concerns. Despite a high court directive to halt the strike, unions proceeded, demanding the release of 38 months of arrears.

title: Centre opposes lowering age of consent, cites risk of trafficking, abuse
content: Move would dilute child protection laws and increase exploitation under guise of assent, Union government tells Supreme Court

title: With consistent government investment on education, infrastructure, Tamil Nadu is poised for growth: experts
content: Tamil Nadu, unlike many other States, is not dependent on one specific sector, said Jerry Kingsley, Head of Value and Risk Advisory in India and City Capital Markets, Chennai JLL

title: Parliamentary panel pitches for ESG oversight body to combat greenwashing activities
content: According to the committee, there is a need for statutory amendments to the Companies Act, 2013, to explicitly enshrine ESG objectives as integral components of Directors’ fiduciary duties

title: Soaring prices to make this year’s Onam feast a costly affair for Keralites
content: Setting the trend ahead of Onam, thousands of caterers in the business of preparing Onasadya, the traditional feast, have started taking bookings in Kerala

title: Jinnah Tower Centre in Guntur should be renamed: A.P. BJP chief
content: P. V. N. Madhav argued that names and symbols should align with the spirit of a modern and unified India

title: Watch: Never ending music of 91-year-old violinist Meenakshi Subramanian in Tamil Nadu
content: Ninety-one-year-old Meenakshi Subramanian in Mathirimangalam, in Tamil Nadu’s Mayiladuthurai district is keeping the spirits of music alive by playing violin till date

title: Political parties hit the streets in J&K for statehood, denounce BJP
content: J&K chief spokesperson of Congress party, Ravinder Sharma, said the BJP undermined the democratically elected government and is running the affairs through a “remote control” from Lt Governor Manoj Sinha’s office.

title: Meet on Wednesday, August 06, to focus on skilling A.P. youth in solar and wind energy technologies
content: The event being organised by A.P. State Skill Development Corporation in Vijayawada on Wednesday is designed to mark a paradigm shift in aligning workforce development with climate resilience and industrial growth

title: Potential for land investments beyond Chennai booming: G Square Group MD Bala Ramajayam
content: Bala Ramajayam said Coimbatore ranks next to Chennai as a major hub for land deals. The demand is steadily rising in Madurai and Tiruchi too.

title: ED raids ex-IAS officer, others in ₹105 crore SCERT 'fraud' case in Assam
content: The money laundering case stems from a May 2023 FIR filed by the State police on the directions of the Assam CM's Special Vigilance Cell.

title: Tribal farmer dies as bike goes up in flames in Telangana
content: According to the police, the deceased, identified as Parsika Raju of Vennelabailu, was travelling on his motorcycle to his agricultural field when the bike came in contact with a dangling high-tension electricity wire near his farmland.

title: Satya Pal Malik (1946-2025): A Governor who stood by his principles
content: A strong advocate of upholding farmers’ interests above the party line, Mr. Malik burned his bridges with the BJP after the farmers’ agitation

title: Uttarkashi cloudburst LIVE: At least four killed, several feared washed away; Modi, Shah speak to CM Dhami, assure Centre’s help
content: NDRF, SDRF and ITBP teams have been deployed for rescue operations; Uttarkashi District Emergency Operation Centre has issued the following emergency numbers: 01374222126, 01374222722, 9456556431

title: Parliament extends President's Rule in Manipur by six months
content: The resolution, which was passed by the Lok Sabha last week, was approved by the Rajya Sabha, amid ruckus over electoral rolls revision issue in Bihar.

title: We live in uncertain times, collective desire to see 'fair and representative' global order: EAM Jaishankar
content: Traditions are of particular value because ultimately they define identities. We must be assured of what we are if we want to be confident about shaping the future, says EAM S. Jaishankar

title: Tamil Nadu people are not naive to get provoked by Madurai Adheenam’s ‘unnecessary’ comments: Madras High Court
content: Justice D. Bharatha Chakravarthy says the ascetic may have made exaggerated remarks but wonders if that would warrant criminal prosecution

title: Cloudburst in Uttarkashi, many feared washed away
content: The cloudburst took place in the catchment area of the Kheer Ganga river, leading to the devastating floods, locals said

title: Half of wells in 10 Kerala districts found contaminated in national water quality survey
content: Tests as part of National Water Quality Monitoring Programme initiated by Central Pollution Control Board reveal varying levels of contamination

title: Panneerselvam criticises DMK government on vacancies in Tamil Nadu dental hospitals
content: In a statement, Mr. Panneerselvam urged Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin to fill up these vacancies in State-run dental colleges through recruitment by the Medical Services Recruitment Board

title: India, Philippines announce strategic partnership
content: Strengthening defence relations a symbol of deep mutual trust between India and Philippines, says PM Modi

title: Tariff war will worsen economy more than COVID-19 pandemic: Kerala Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal
content: Balagopal suggests that academic community organise a roundtable discussion on the implications of these policies for India and Kerala to generate clarity on what lies ahead for the economy

title: Bankey Bihari temple ordinance not intended to interfere in religious rights, only limited to secular activities of the ancient temple: UP govt in SC
content: The court was hearing a plea of the management committee of the temple which has challenged the ordinance.

title: The Hindu’s coffee table book on Tamil Nadu’s temple architecture released
content: The coffee table book, ‘Evolution of temple architecture in Tamil Nadu’ was authored by Vrinda Ramanan and J. Ramanan. It is available for sale in The Hindu Group’s online bookstore.

title: CPI(M) condemns Adoor Gopalakrishnan’s position that would-be filmmakers from marginalised sections and women require intense training
content: M.V. Govindan says Adoor Gopalakrishnan’s words ‘smacked of feudal putrescence and such discourses are an injustice to a modern, democratic and progressive society such as ours’

title: Heavy rain lashes central Kerala; red alert for four districts on August 5
content: Heavy rainfall likely to continue for one more day under the influence of upper air cyclonic circulation that lies over southwest Bay of Bengal off the north Tamil Nadu coast

title: Sambhal temple-mosque row: Court sets August 21 to hear case
content: Advocate Shri Gopal Sharma, appearing for one side, said, “Due to the bar association strike today, the court has fixed August 21 as the next date of hearing.”

title: LDF loses power in Koothattukulam municipality in Kerala after beleaguered CPI(M) councillor Kala Raju backs UDF’s no-confidence motion
content: Kala Raju had shifted her allegiance to UDF after she was allegedly abducted by CPI(M) workers while she was on her way to cast her vote in a no-confidence motion moved by Opposition in January

title: Tamil Nadu Real Estate Regulatory Authority to provide project-specific information online
content: Pointing to the issues pertaining to violation of advertisement guidelines, the TNRERA Chairperson Shiv Das Meena said advertising should be factual and responsible.

title: INDIA bloc says Supreme Court observations on Rahul Gandhi is ‘unwarranted’; Priyanka Gandhi says judges can’t decide who is a true Indian
content: The Supreme Court on August 4, 2025, stayed the proceedings against Rahul Gandhi before a Lucknow court over his remarks about the Army during his December 2022 Bharat Jodo Yatra

title: Parliament Monsoon Session: Uproar in Rajya Sabha over the presence of CISF personnel inside the House
content: Leader of Opposition Mallikarjun Kharge asks whether the Rajya Sabha was run from the Chair or by Union Home Minister Amit Shah; Deputy Chairman Harivansh and Union Minister Kiren Rijiju deny the presence of CISF inside the House

title: Supreme Court likely to hear plea seeking restoration of statehood to J&K on August 8
content: “The delay in the restoration of statehood would cause serious reduction of democratically elected government in Jammu and Kashmir, causing a grave violation of the idea of federalism which forms part of the basic structure of the Constitution of India,” the application said.

title: Customs officials bust smuggling racket, rescue 30 star tortoises at Bengaluru airport
content: Sources said he had procured the consignment from Chikkaballapur, received them at Kalasipalya bus stand, before heading to the airport

title: Water tanker plunges into drain after road caves in at Hyderabad’s Banjara Hills
content: The incident was reported near a bylane close to Virinchi Hospital, where a section of the concrete cover over a drainage channel gave way, causing the tanker to fall

title: Buzz from NFL training camps: What we learned about the Packers, Ravens, Titans and 13 more teams
content: Our national reporters visited 16 NFL teams since training camps began, talking to players and coaches about what to expect this season.

title: Sources: Banged-up Browns sign 5th QB in Huntley
content: The Browns are signing quarterback Tyler Huntley, sources said, adding depth with multiple passers nursing injuries.

title: Chargers' Perryman out of jail, won't face charges
content: Chargers linebacker Denzel Perryman was released from police custody Monday afternoon and will not face criminal charges after he was arrested Friday night.

title: Sources: Raiders trade CB Bennett to Eagles
content: The Raiders are trading cornerback Jakorian Bennett to the Eagles in exchange for defensive tackle Thomas Booker IV, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Boone: Judge rejoining Yanks for Tuesday's game
content: Yankees slugger Aaron Judge will be activated from the injured list before Tuesday's game against the Rangers, manager Aaron Boone said after his team lost its fourth straight Monday.

title: New Cubs starter Soroka (shoulder) headed to IL
content: New Chicago Cubs starter Mike Soroka left his first game with his new team with right shoulder discomfort and will require a stint on the injured list.

title: Sources: LeBron congratulated Luka on new deal
content: LeBron James congratulated Luka Doncic on his new three-year, $165 million contract extension via a video call Saturday, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Guards' Enright, battling cancer, earns first save
content: Guardians reliever Nic Enright recorded his first career save on Monday night, more than three years after he was diagnosed with Hodgkin lymphoma.

title: Fan accused of sex toy toss faces multiple charges
content: The man arrested for allegedly throwing a sex toy onto the court during last week's Valkyries-Dream game faces charges of disorderly conduct, public indecency/indecent exposure and criminal trespass, according to law enforcement records.

title: 🛑Fantasy football: Do Not Draft list
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in fantasy football drafts.

content: What we learned from the deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: The 11 teams that make the inaugural college football Impatience Index
content: CFP aspirations. Major investments. Too many losses. Fans are never patient, but these teams might have a right.

title: From another title in OKC to new plans in Phoenix, what is every team 'all-in' for in 2025-26?
content: Not everyone can be all-in for the title in 2025-26. See each franchise's priority No. 1 for the upcoming season.

content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: WNBA trade grades: Wings cut ties with Carrington, look to future
content: The Lynx added DiJonai Carrington as WNBA contenders upgrade their rosters before the Aug. 7 trade deadline.

title: Inside the winning formula that has Clemson poised for a championship run
content: With Cade Klubnik heading a large group of returnees, Dabo Swinney has Tigers fans thinking national title.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: From Real Madrid to Man United, have last season's issues been fixed this summer?
content: There are several big clubs that regressed in a major way last season, including Real Madrid (no defense) and Man United (scoring goals). Have these 10 clubs done enough to fix those issues in the offseason?

title: Breaking down the FC 100: Which clubs were best represented? Who made the list for the 9th straight year?
content: While this year's FC 100 saw a staggering number of new faces, three stalwarts have made every edition of the rankings. Here's what else we learned from digging into the data.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Current pick right up where they left off
content: The NWSL is back from its summer break, and the Kansas City Current haven't skipped a beat. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Pickups: Seven players seizing post-deadline opportunity
content: As the MLB season moves beyond the trade deadline, here are the players you should be claiming off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: Betting buzz: Baldwin favorite as Misiorowski injury shakes up NL Rookie race
content: Drake Baldwin emerges as heavy NL Rookie of the Year favorite after Jacob Misiorowski's odds slide after injury.

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: 'I am useless': Hamilton spiraling in dire Ferrari debut year
content: In February, Lewis Hamilton was full of smiles, eager to win a championship for Ferrari. Six months later, he sounds defeated.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Mayawati denies alliance with BJP, says BSP to work independently
content: Urging party workers and supporters to remain alert, Mayawati said such "dirty tactics" are part of political conspiracies aimed at weakening the Ambedkarite movement.

title: DRDO guest house manager held in Jaisalmer on suspicion of spying for Pakistan
content: Mahendra Prasad, a resident of Uttarakhand's Almora, was posted as the manager of DRDO guest house in Chandan area of Jaisalmer

title: SWR operates special trains to ease pain of commuters hit by indefinite strike by RTC bus employees in Karnataka
content: Additional train services have been arranged between key destinations on August 5 to help commuters affected by the absence of regular bus services

title: Negligence in desilting has delayed Cauvery water reaching tail-end areas in Tamil Nadu: Nainar Nagenthran
content: In a statement, the BJP Tamil Nadu president said the Kuruvai paddy crop in Nagapattinam, Mayiladuthurai and Tiruvarur districts had started to wither due to the non-availability of adequate water for irrigation.

title: NDA passes resolution praising PM Modi, armed forces for Operation Sindoor, Operation Mahadev
content: The Prime Minister also praised Home Minister Amit Shah and noted that he has become the longest-serving incumbent in the Ministry

title: Coal linkage recommended for development of Ennore Thermal Power Station expansion project
content: The Central Electricity Authority (CEA) noted that the coal linkage for the project has been recommended based on the Resource Adequacy Plan accepted by Tamil Nadu.

title: MEA’s latest statement indicates India may change tack to face U.S. tariffs, E.U. sanctions over Russian oil
content: Amongst measures Delhi could consider are FTA deals with ASEAN and others, restarting oil imports from Iran and Venezuela

title: Man murders three daughters, kills self in Namakkal
content: The farmer locked his wife and one-year-old son in the bedroom and killed his three daughters, severing their heads with a sickle.

title: Strike hits KSRTC bus services in Mysuru
content: As an alternative measure, private buses were operating from the bus stand following a meeting convened by the Deputy Commissioner, Superintendent of Police, and Regional Transport Officers

title: Sonia, Priyanka, other Opposition leaders protest against SIR in Parliament premises
content: The Opposition has been protesting in both Houses of Parliament against the SIR, alleging the ECI's exercise was aimed at "disenfranchising voters" in Bihar ahead of the Assembly elections.

title: Kerala Education Minister proposes classrooms without ‘backbenchers’
content: V. Sivankutty, in a Facebook post, says being deemed a backbencher can possibly impact a student’s confidence and learning

title: Anil Ambani appears before Enforcement Directorate in bank loan 'fraud' linked PMLA case
content: The action pertains to alleged financial irregularities and collective loan "diversion" pegged at more than ₹17,000 crore by multiple group companies of Anil Ambani, including Reliance Infrastructure (R Infra).

title: Indian Energy Exchange logs record trade volume of 12,664 MUs in July
content: A total of 16.26 lakh Renewable Energy Certificates (RECa) were traded during the month, an IEX statement said.

title: Thieves try to pull away ATM using SUV, fail
content: Four people came in a sports utility vehicle (SUV) and tied the ATM to it with a yellow coloured belt. They tried to pull the ATM with the help of the vehicle but did not succeed, a police official said.

title: NWKRTC strike paralyses public transport in Belagavi district of Karnataka
content: A team of police officers were deputed for security duty in the bus stand. They were seen talking to commuters who were complaining that they were unable to travel due to lack of buses

title: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh granted 40-day parole
content: The latest parole granted by the court to Ram Rahim Singh comes months after he walked out of the Sunaria jail in Haryana’s Rohtak after being granted a 21-day furlough in April.

title: Hemant Soren pens an emotional tribute to his father Shibu Soren
content: Shibu Soren’s last rites and funeral would be performed later in the day at his native village Nemra.

title: Kerala rains: Cab using navigation app falls into canal; heavy rain leaves many areas in Kochi inundated
content: Heavy early-morning showers left many vulnerable stretches in Kochi city and Ernakulam district flooded even as IMD sounded a red alert for Ernakulam on Tuesday

title: Shibu Soren funeral LIVE: At Nemra, Shibu Soren’s native village prepares to bid adieu
content: Former Jharkhand CM to be laid to rest at ancestral village with full state honours; Jharkhand Assembly pays tribute to the former CM

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 12 highlights: Rajya Sabha adopts resolution to extend President’s rule in Manipur, Parliament adjourns for the day
content: The Lower House passed the the Readjustment of Representation of Scheduled Tribes Assembly Constituencies of the State of Goa, 2024 Bill through loud Opposition protests.

title: Philippines President in India updates: India, Philippines announce strategic partnership
content: PM Modi says strengthening defence relations between India and Philippines is symbol of deep mutual trust.

title: Probe under way into alleged sexual assault of child in Thane school
content: Parents alleged, a person in blue clothes sexually assaulted their daughter in the school premises on July 30 between 11.15 am and 3 pm, the officials said.

title: Gas leak blast in Hyderabad’s Medchal market kills one, injures two
content: Preliminary investigation revealed that a leak in the gas pipe had allowed gas to accumulate in the poorly ventilated space, leading to a blast when the stove was ignited.

title: Karnataka receives proposals worth ₹17,000 crore for Vijayapura District
content: Some 30 companies from the FMCG sector, 25 from the solar sector, and 15 from the textile sector have shown interest in investing in Vijayapura

title: Karnataka bus strike: Inter-city and intra-city services hit across State, but Bengaluru unaffected
content: The Karnataka High Court had directed trade unions to put the strike on hold for at least a day. Despite this, the JAC went ahead with its protest

title: Consent of women employees willing to work at night compulsory in Odisha
content: No adolescent will be allowed to work in any establishment during night and employer will have to provide washroom and drinking water facilities near the workplace and ensure provisions of closed-circuit television (CCTV) surveillance, says State Government

title: IAF’s unending fighter conundrum | Explained
content: Why have the MiG-21 fighter jets been called ‘flying coffins’? Why has the induction of Mk-1A jets been delayed? How many jets does the Indian Air Force intend to induct in the next two decades? Are the engines for India’s fifth generation fighter aircraft going to be indigenously developed?

title: Akali Dal protests against Punjab govt’s land pooling policy
content: ‘We will not allow one inch of land to be acquired under the AAP government’s land grabbing scheme’, says Sukhbir Singh Badal.

title: MNS chief Raj Thackeray cites bonhomie with Uddhav, urges MNS cadre to unite
content: ‘After 20 years if we brothers can come together, why can’t you put aside your differences?,’ Raj Thackeray tells partymen.

title: Uttar Pradesh floods: Varanasi Namo Ghat flooded as water level of Ganga River rises
content: Incessant rainfall in U.P. has led to floods in 13 districts of the State; all schools in Varanasi, across all boards and up to Class 12, will remain closed on August 5 and 6

title: Modi-Marcos Jr. talks will significantly deepen bilateral ties: Jaishankar
content: The visit of President Marcos Jr coincides with the 75th anniversary of India-Philippines diplomatic relations

title: Family of Jaipur man abducted in Mali seeks PM’s intervention to secure release
content: Prakash Chandra Joshi, 61, was among the three Indian nationals abducted in the Kayes region of Mali during an armed assault by suspected terrorists on July 1; the family says they have no information about his whereabouts

title: BJP raises spectre of ‘political Islam’ infiltrating Church in Kerala
content: BJP State vice-president Shone George says that radical Islamists, beholden to the SDPI and Jamaat-e-Islami, had infiltrated Church protests in sizeable numbers

title: BJP accuses Rahul Gandhi of making ‘immature’ comments against Armed Forces
content: “Such immature, anti-Army, and demoralising statements made without any evidence or facts, especially when our Army was engaged in the Galwan incident, raise serious questions,” said Gaurav Bhatia

title: Congress leaders speak in different voices on Trump’s tariff threat
content: Jairam Ramesh calls out ‘image building’ exercise as part of foreign policy; his party colleague Manish Tewari asks U.S. President Trump not to lose sleep over additional tariffs

title: As per SC order, J&K govt. takes over iconic Nedou’s Hotel in Gulmarg
content: The Nedou’s family and their staff, ran the place for the past 137 years; it was a smooth transition, says official

title: Do not politicise my meeting with Stalin, says O. Panneerselvam
content: In a statement, he terms as “indecent” the attempts by some to paint his visit to the Chief Minister’s residence in a political light

title: Russia Backs India Over Oil Imports, Says "Have Right To Choose Trading Partner"
content: Russia has accused the United States of exerting illegal trade pressure on India over its oil imports from them after US President Donald Trump threatened to raise tariffs citing purchase of Russian oil.

title: BJP Member Raises Concerns Over Code 'GAY' For Gaya Airport, Centre Responds
content: A BJP member in Rajya Sabha has raised concerns about 'GAY' as the IATA identifier code for Gaya international airport in Bihar.

title: 4 Dead, 50 Missing After Flash Floods In Uttarakhand, Amit Shah Takes Stock
content: Horrifying visuals surfaced in which a strong stream of water can be seen flowing down from a hill towards the Dharali village in Uttarkashi, causing huge destruction.

title: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari's Convoy Attacked In Bengal's Cooch Behar
content: Suvendu Adhikari, the Leader of the Opposition in the West Bengal assembly, was attacked while he was leading a protest rally in Cooch Behar.

title: Saudi Arabia's Tourism Shift From Skyscrapers To Mountain Villages
content: Saudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund, called the Public Investment Fund (PIF), and private investors are working on master plans costing billions of dollars for projects that can be enjoyed year-round.

title: Adani Ports Clocks 21% Revenue Jump At Rs 9,126 Crore In First Quarter
content: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited (APSEZ) on Tuesday reported a 21 per cent jump in quarterly revenue at Rs 9,126 crore, driven by a 2 times jump in logistics and a 2.9 times increase in marine.

title: Delhi Education Minister Tables Bill To Regulate Private School Fees
content: Delhi Education Minister Ashish Sood lashed out at the previous government, saying that parents were going to court with their children over fees. The minister tabled the Delhi School Education Bill, 2025 in the Delhi Assembly.

title: Uttarkashi Cloudburst Updates: Cloudburst Leads To Flash Floods, Many People Missing
content: Uttarkashi Flash Floods Updates: Horrifying visuals of the incident showed a strong stream of water flowing down from a hill towards the Tharali village, sweeping away many houses.

title: UP Teacher Suspended, Charged For Showing Obscene Videos To Students
content: A schoolmaster here was accused by several female students of exposing them to explicit videos, police said on Tuesday.

title: US Wanted India To Buy Russian Oil When Ukraine War Started. What Changed
content: In a now-viral video, Garcetti can be heard admitting that it was Washington that had encouraged New Delhi to buy oil from Moscow at a price cap to stabilise global prices.

title: How Google Search Helped Missing Karnataka Woman Reunite With Family
content: A mentally ill woman, hailing from Karnataka and missing for the last one-and-a-half years, has been reunited with her family with the help of Google Search and efforts by a social organisation in Maharashtra.

title: UK Woman Accuses Tunisia Parasail Operator Of Groping, Sexual Assault
content: Michelle Wilson, 52, initially intended to parasail with a friend but was told by staff that windy conditions meant both women would have to go separately with an operator.

title: All Roads In Jharkhand Lead To Shibu Soren's Native Village Nemra
content: A sombre atmosphere prevailed in Nemra on Tuesday as people from near and far thronged the village in Jharkhand's Ramgarh district to have a last glimpse of former chief minister Shibu Soren, who is fondly known as 'Dishom Guru' by the masses.

title: Trinamool MP's "Apology To Nation" For Backing Colleague Mahua Moitra
content: A day after he resigned as the Trinamool Congress's chief whip in Lok Sabha amid a churn in the party, senior MP Kalyan Banerjee today launched a fresh attack on party colleague Mahua Moitra, saying she "lacks basic gratitude"

title: Opinion: Opinion | Kneel, Deal, Or Bleed: The Trump-enomics Wrecking The World
content: Since returning to the Oval Office, Trump has been on a tariff rampage. The global trading system is unrecognisable. Tariffs have become weapons, trade partners have been reduced to negotiators, and the WTO is now functionally comatose.

title: 'Banke Bihari Temple Ordinance For Better Administration': UP After Supreme Court Rap
content: The petitioners have challenged the validity of Uttar Pradesh Shri Bankey Bihari Ji Temple Trust Ordinance, 2025, for reportedly taking over the management of the ancient temple.

title: Post Op Sindoor, Air Force, Navy To Place Mega Orders For BrahMos Missiles
content: Soon after they caused significant damage to Pakistani military infrastructure during Operation Sindoor, Indian forces are placing mega orders for the Indo-Russian joint venture BrahMos supersonic cruise missiles.

title: US Man Convicted Of Double Murder, Had Left 8-Year-Old Alone With Bodies
content: William Jerome Adams, 29, has been convicted of shooting Mary Lindsay and Muhammad Jr to death. He was given two consecutive life sentences without the chance of parole, according to a statement from the Gwinnett County District Attorney's Office.

title: Trump Targets India, Spares China Despite It Buying More Russian Oil: Report
content: US President Donald Trump has been unfairly targeting India over Russian oil imports, while choosing not to criticise China, according to a recent report by the Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI).

title: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
content: the 12-team college football playoff will again include the five highest-ranked conference champions . there are 32 teams -- the most in the CFP era -- with at least a 10% chance of reaching the playoff . the list will shrink by November, but below it starts with 32 teams ranked in order of their percentage chance .

title: Night 2 results: Lesnar returns, Rhodes wins undisputed WWE championship
content: SummerSlam Night 2 featured the latest installment of the  John Cena retirement tour , as he put his Undisputed WWE Championship up for grabs against former titleholder Cody Rhodes at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey. After a marathon "street fight" match, Rhodes won his title back from the legend Cena. After the match, Brock Lesnar made his return to the WWE, delivering an F-5 to a stunned Cena. That was the final of many title matches on Night 2. Naomi retained her title in the opening match of the card, and Becky Lynch retained hers with a win over Lyra Valkyria. Later, Solo Sikoa outlasted Jacob Fatu in a steel cage match to retain the United States Championship, and Dominik Mysterio held on to the men's Intercontinental Championship with a win over AJ Styles. ESPN reporter Greg Wyshynski highlights the biggest moments and more from SummerSlam Night 2.
